Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the TV station airing the election results a week early, as it was actually a test of their systems and not real results.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the assertion that a Detroit TV station aired the election results a week early.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the airing of the election results a week early was intentional and not a mistake or technical error.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the airing of the election results a week early was a result of a technical error or miscommunication.
